byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Rome, and Merna Thomas from Cairo.

abstract: Upcoming diplomatic meetings between American and Egyptian officials will probably include discussion on violent death and torture of Giulio Regeni, Italian doctoral student and researcher whose body was found in Cairo four days earlier; Italy suspects Egyptian security forces played role in his death of Regeni, who went missing Jan 25.
lead_paragraph: Diplomatic visits come amid pressure by Italy for Egypt to find the killers of an Italian doctoral candidate, Giulio Regeni, whose badly beaten body was found in Cairo.

headline.main: Italian Student’s Brutal Killing May Be Issue in Egypt-U.S. Meetings
headline.print_headline: Italian’s Killing May Be Raised in U.S. Talks With Egypt

snippet: Diplomatic visits come amid pressure by Italy for Egypt to find the killers of an Italian doctoral candidate, Giulio Regeni, whose badly beaten body was found in Cairo.
